title: Flash Memory Cards Market to Grow at 4.4% CAGR from 2014 to 2019
content:
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150923/269737 

The Complete Global Flash Memory Cards Market 2015 – 2019 report of 64 pages is available at http://www.rnrmarketresearch.com/global-flash-memory-cards-market-2015-2019-market-report.html. The report supports the market research with 22 

The analysts forecast global flash memory card market to grow at a CAGR of 4.4% over the period 2014-2019.

According to the Global Flash Memory Cards Market report, growing interest in photography is fueling demand for high-resolution and multi-format supporting cameras and camcorders. The digital camera segment is witnessing high adoption for its easy usage and capability to capture high-quality images. This demand, in turn, propels the demand for storage devices. Thus, consumers prefer memory cards to meet their storage requirements. Moreover, the affordability of high-end cameras is low and, hence, a majority of consumers choose moderate and low-end cameras.

Further, the report states that one of the challenges of flash memory cards is, it corrupt easily, leading to the loss of data. A device can corrupt due to abrupt removal of the card, sudden power surge during formatting, generation of a corrupted file or a virus attack.

The following companies are the key players in the Global Flash Memory Card Market: Kingston Technology, Samsung Semiconductor, SanDisk, Toshiba Electronics and Transcend Information.

Other Prominent Vendors in the market are: ADATA, C & R Partnership, Cactus, CV Electronics Graha Perkasa, Delkin, Eye-Fi, Fusion Computer, Guangzhou Zhonghao Electronics, Hoodman, KINGMAX, Lexar (Micron Consumer Products Group), PNY Technologies, RT Plus International, Satyam Electronics, Shenzhen Hailan Info-Tech, Shenzhen Odin Electronic Technology, Shenzhen Sagitta Technology, Shenzhen Z. S. H. Technology, Sony, Starline International Group, Strontium and Vizio Digital Electronics.
